word.wordExample: W1
The panda has got a white head but black legs.
Mary has got long brown hair.
I have got thirty-two teeth in my mouth.
Tech has got short arms, but long legs.
- What have you got in your hands? - Cherries!
I have got ten fingers on my hands.
Cats have got four legs.
The red shoes are too small for my feet.
I have got ten toes on my feet.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Let's create a story with kings and queens.
Messi is a very good football player.
My sister is like my mother, with black hair and green eyes.
Mr Gardner has got sheep on his farm. He has also got horses.
Your jeans are very trendy.
I have got a tablet but I haven’t got a laptop.
Have we got any apples?
My doll has got long blonde hair.

phrase.phraseExample: You are a very good student. Well done!
Level 1 complete! Let’s go to level 2!

word.wordExample: W1
My toys are in my bedroom.
There is a toilet in my bathroom.
We cook in the kitchen.
There is a big TV in the living room.
In the summer, we sit on the balcony.
My house has got a garden with flowers and trees.

generalWord.generalWordExample: I have got an English project for school.
Pizza is my favourite food.
Santorini is a beautiful place.
There are six rooms in my house.
My parents’ names are Olivia and Harry.
Basketball players are very tall.
Grandma's house is old. It isn't modern.
I like your T-shirt! It’s nice!
Anna has got beautiful big blue eyes.
Tulips are my favourite flowers.
My bed is very comfortable.

phrase.phraseExample: Monopoly is a great game. I like it!

word.wordExample: W1
There is a big comfortable sofa in the living room.
I have got a lamp on my desk.
WeThere are some bananas on the kitchen table.
Sit on this chair, please.
Those books in the bookcase are Jason’s.
My bookcase has got seven shelves.
My sister has got five dresses in the wardrobe.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Let's find the answer to this question.
There is a map of London in my geography book.
New York is in the USA.
- Let’s go to the park! - That’s a great idea! / - There is chocolate cake in the kitchen. - Great! Let’s eat it!
My brother isn’t here now. He’s at the cinema.
I like my burger with ketchup.
This is not a real dog. It’s a toy.
I like your bike. It’s cool!
My skateboard is fantastic!

phrase.phraseExample: -Good morning children! Let’s start the lesson.
- Where is my school bag, Mum? - It’s on your bed!
We are first! We did it!

word.wordExample: W1
My favourite subject is art, because I love colours.
In IT we learn about computer technology.
In the PE lesson we do sports.
I like maths because I am very good with numbers.
I read history books about Rome.
Nancy has got a geography project about Asia.
Our science lesson today is about the sun.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Are your parents back from work?
Mario is new at this school.
Emily is a very smart girl and she is beautiful, too.
Fabio loves spaghetti because he’s from Italy.
There are twenty students in my class this year.
A year has got four seasons and twelve months.
English is a very interesting subject. I like it!
I find this puzzle very easy. Let's do it!
MyI play basketball because it’s fun!
Let's find Greece on the map.

phrase.phraseExample: I don't know this boy. What's his name?
Come on, children! Let’s go to the park and play!
- Hello, my name is Nick! - Nice to meet you!

word.wordExample: W1
There are twenty-five desks in my classroom.
The school library has got interesting books.
-Where is the PE teacher? - He's in the gym.
There are three microscopes in the science lab.
Let’s have some lemonade at the school canteen.
The teachers’ toilets are on the first floor.
The children aren't in the classroom now. They're in the playground.
We go to the swimming pool in the summer.

generalWord.generalWordExample: This shop is big! It has got seven floors! / Let’s sit on the floor and read a story.
I like the food in that restaurant.
This is a very tasty burger.
Oh, listen! The bell! Open the door, please.

phrase.phraseExample: -Where is the bathroom, please? – It’s the second door on your left.
Look! The library is on your right!
- Bye Eric! - Goodbye Andy! See you later!
This place is great! It's my dream school!

word.wordExample: W1
Ken has got a blue notebook for the science lesson.
Lucy’s rubber is next to her pencil.
Colour the sun with a yellow marker, children!
There are pencils, pens and a rubber in my pencil case.
I haven’t got a pencil sharpener because I write with a pen.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My dad reads articles about sports.
My mum has got some women's magazines on her desk.
ThisThere are ninety-three pupils in our school.

I’m hungry! Let’s have a snack!

I play the flute and the violin.
- Where is Akira from? - He's from Japan.

- Where is Ethiopia? - It's in Africa.

phrase.phraseExample: I have got friends from all around the world.
- I don’t know this game. - It’s called Pictionary!

Let’s run. We‘re late for school.

Linda and Pedro can dance the Samba.
The children draw with pencils and markers.
Mario can speak English and Italian.
We ride our bikes in the park every Sunday.
Ethan is 12 years old. He can’t drive a car.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My birthday is a special day.
You swim very fast! You’ve got a special talent.
There are some new students in my class this year. / Let’s play some music!
My cousin is a musician. He can play the guitar and the violin.
Mary can’t walk very well because she is a baby. / - All the children are in the classroom, Mr. Davis. - Well, let’s start the lesson!
Children learn how to read and write at school.
Mr. Scott is in a wheelchair because he can’t walk.
I walk to school every day.
Beyonce is a fantastic singer.
My grandma is old and can’t hear very well.
I am sometimes late for school.

phrase.phraseExample: This new film is great! Don’t you agree?

word.wordExample: W1
Emily gets up for school at 7:00 in the morning.
Jack always brushes his teeth in the evening.
At weekends we have breakfast/lunch/dinner at grandma’s house.
My sister often does her homework in the library.
I usually go to bed late in the evening.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My parents are often very busy in the morning.
My friend Betty is a very nice girl.
- Are you ok my dear? -Yes, I’m fine!
MySorry, I can’t come with you today.
Today people sometimes send letters, but they usually send e-mails.

My cousins are from Greece but they live in Italy.
There is a beautiful park near our house.
Dad usually helps Mum tidy the house. / I sometimes ask for help when I do my homework.
Grandma feeds her cats twice a day.
I tidy my bedroom every afternoon.

phrase.phraseExample: Thanks for the beautiful flowers!
We have breakfast at 8 o’ clock every day.
Time for bed kids! It’s very late!
- I’m from Greece. What about you? - I’m from England.
Write back soon! Bye for now!

word.wordExample: W1
Raphael Nadal is my favourite tennis player.
Karate is a sport from Japan.
We never go swimming in the winter. The sea is very cold.
My family and I often go skiing in the Alps.
My sister does gymnastics every week. She can dance with a ball on her hands.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Everybody has fun at Jim’s parties.

Liam is an athlete and trains hard every day.

This maths problem is very difficult. Mums help me, please!
-What other sports do you do? - I play tennis and volleyball.

phrase.phraseExample: Have fun at the party, children!
In my free time I read books.

phrase.phraseEnglish: - Thank you very much! - You’re welcome!
phrase.phraseExample: - Thank you very much for your help! - You’re welcome!

word.wordExample: W1
It’s ten past seven.
It’s ten to seven.
It’s a quarter past seven.
It’s a quarter to seven.
It’s half past seven.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Zebras run fast and sometimes escape from lions.
-Where are my car keys, dear? - I think they’re on the table.
I always write little notes to help me remember.
The film starts at 9:30 and now it’s 9:15. We’ve got only 15 minutes!

I wear my blue jacket every day in winter.

I can’t hear what you say.

Our teacher tells us to exercise often.
My clock says it’s 9 o’clock.
Taboo is my favourite board game.

phrase.phraseExample: You’re always late! Hurry up, please!
- What time is it? - It’s ten to two.
These photos are great! Good job!

word.wordExample: W1
Disney creates fantastic cartoons.
My dad reads the news on the Internet every morning.

I love documentaries about lions and tigers.

I like the songs from that from that TV talent show.
My friends and I watch football matches every Sunday.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Mr. Lewis can’t meet you today. What about next Monday?
You can choose the blue car or the green one.
Let’s sit on the sofa and watch TV.

It’s easy for me to learn Italian because I speak Spanish.
My sister always takes my things.
We’ve got a surprise for Lisa’s birthday.

phrase.phraseExample: - Let’s sit in the living room. - What’s on TV?
There’s a great film on TV this weekend. Don’t miss it!
- What’s on next? -There’s a new film at 7 o’clock.

My mum loves listening to music on the radio.
I like doing puzzles with my little sister.
Rosie enjoys playing chess and other board games.
At weekends, I meet my friends and we play basketball.

I like talking about art and music with my friends.

phrase.phraseExample: -This burger is great! You can try it!

word.wordExample: W1
Mum feeds the baby five times a day.
Dad always helps me with maths.
I’ve got a big brother. He’s 18 years old.

My grandpa is 70 years old and has got grey hair.
My grandma is old and she can’t walk. She uses a wheelchair.
We usually visit our grandparents at weekends.
This is Aunt Sarah, my mother’s sister.
My dad’s brother, Uncle Tom, can play the drums!
I love playing with my cousins at our grandparents’ house.

generalWord.generalWordExample: Every Sunday we have lunch all together.

When I go to England, I always eat fish and chips.
I like this film. It’s really nice.
Be quiet! My parents are sleeping at the moment.

phrase.phraseExample: Guess what! We are having a baby!

Can you set the table, dear? It’s time for lunch.
See you soon, Amy! Take care!

I’m really angry because she always takes my things.
This lesson is not interesting. I’m bored!

My little sister is scared of witches.
I’m hungry, Mum! Let’s make a pizza.
I’m very thirsty right now! I want a glass of water.

generalWord.generalWordExample: - I can’t ride my bike very well, Dad! - We can try together! / This food is very tasty! Let’s try it!
- Can we have lunch now, Mum? - Wash your hands first, please! / The baby is scared because it’s his first time at the doctor’s.
The word ‘family’ has got six letters.
When I don’t know the correct answer I often guess it.
The baby sometimes cries at night because she’s hungry.
Are these tears? Why are you crying?
I’m not very well. So I’m not coming to the party.
Linda reads very much so she knows a lot of things.
- Why are you screaming? - There is a mouse under my bed!

phrase.phraseExample: When I play board games with my friends, we always have a good time.
- I can’t find my umbrella. - Don’t worry! I’ve got one.
- Let’s start the game! - Pick a card!

word.wordExample: W1
I love cartoons. They’re really funny!
Our teacher is always serious. He never tells jokes.
Victoria enjoys making new things. She’s very creative.
This idea is amazing! Well done Tina! You’re very smart!
Miranda is very nice and friendly to everyone.
I’m very shy and quiet around people I don’t know.

generalWord.generalWordExample: - What type of sports do you like? - I like team sports.

We can read this article and find out the answer to the question.

Can I have more cake, please?
The only person I know here is you.

phrase.phraseExample: I love spending time with my family.
My uncle always tells jokes. He is very funny!
My best friend and I spend a lot of time together.

Ron enjoys watching videos and playing games on his new tablet.
I wear my smartwatch every day because I can tell the time and also call my friends with it.
Look! A drone is in the air and is taking a video.
Lily’s new camera takes amazing photos and videos.
When I want to watch a film or do a school project, I use my laptop.

generalWord.generalWordExample: My brother thinks that cartoons are only for kids.
The price of this book is £15.
My friends always write nice comments under my profile picture.
This car is fast but it’s small. It isn’t very practical.
This isn’t just a sofa. It is also a bed. / - What are you doing right now? - I’m just starting training at the gym.
- What time is it? - I don’t know. I can’t find my watch.

Do you know that some birds can’t fly?
Look at the stars in the sky! They’re beautiful!
- The price of this dress is £500. - I can’t buy it, it’s very expensive.

phrase.phraseExample: - I like these shoes! How much do they cost? - £50.

My mum doesn’t like difficult gadgets, so her new tablet is very easy to use.
